analyzed: gaganam iva candra vihīnam sasya vihīnā bhavet yathā pṛthivī
translated: like the sky without the moon, or like the earth without crops,

original: nalinīva jalavihīnā bhartṛvihīnā tathā bhaven nārī //
analyzed: nalinī iva jala vihīnā bhartṛ vihīnā tathā bhavet nārī
translated: a woman is like a lotus pond without water, separated from her husband.

original: Viśv bodhisatva uvāca /
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ uvāca
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: avaśyam evāvayor ante viyogena bhavitavyaṃ / eṣa hi lokasvabhāvaḥ / tvaṃ ca pravarānnapānaśayanāsanasaṃvasanopacitā
analyzed: avaśyam eva āvayoḥ ante viyogena bhavitavyam eṣa hi loka svabhāvaḥ tvam ca pravara anna pāna śayana āsana saṃvasana upacitā
translated: We must certainly be separated in the end. This is the nature of the world. And you are nourished by the best food, drink, bedding, seats, and companionship,

original: paramasukumāraśarīrā / tapovane tṛṇaparṇopacitāyāṃ bhūmyāṃ svaptavyaṃ /
analyzed: parama su kumāra śarīrā tapaḥ vane tṛṇa parṇa upacitāyām bhūmyām svaptavyam
translated: with a body extremely delicate. In the penance grove, you will have to sleep on the ground covered with grass and leaves,

original: mūlapuṣpaphalāni cāhāro darbhopalakuśakaṇṭakacitāyāṃ mahyāṃ vicaritavyaṃ abhīkṣṇaṃ copavāsa upavasitavyaḥ /
analyzed: mūla puṣpa phalāni ca āhāraḥ darbha upala kuśa kaṇṭaka citāyām mahyām vicaritavyam abhīkṣṇam ca upavāsaḥ upavasitavyaḥ
translated: Your food will be roots, flowers, and fruits. You will wander on a great plain covered with grass, rocks, kuśa grass, and thorns. You will often fast and observe the fast.

original: sarvajanasyātmā darśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: sarva janasya ātmā darśayitavyaḥ
translated: You will show yourself to be the self of all people.

original: sarvaprayatnenātithayaḥ pūjayitavyās / tatrāpi ca mayā avaśyaṃ yathāśaktyā dānaṃ deyaṃ / tatra bhavatyā na kathaṃcid anutāpaḥ karaṇīyas tat punar
analyzed: sarva prayatnena atithayaḥ pūjayitavyāḥ tatra api ca mayā avaśyam yathāśaktyā dānam deyam tatra bhavatyā na kathaṃcid anutāpaḥ karaṇīyaḥ tat punar
translated: With all your effort you will worship guests. And there too I will certainly give gifts to the best of my ability. You should not feel any regret about that at all.

original: api tāvat saṃpradhāryatām iti /
analyzed: api tāvat saṃpradhāryatām iti
translated: Moreover, let us consider this further.

original: mādrī kathayaty āryaputra yathāśaktyāham āryaputrasya anuvartiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: mādrī kathayati āryaputra yathāśaktyā aham āryaputrasya anuvartiṣyāmi iti
translated: Madrī said, Noble sir, I will follow you to the best of my ability.

original: bodhisatvaḥ kathayati yady evaṃ smartavyā te iyaṃ pratijñeti /
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ kathayati yadi evam smartavyā te iyam pratijñā iti
translated: The Bodhisattva said, If that is so, you should remember this vow of mine.

original: Viśv tato bodhisatvaḥ pitaram abhigamya mūrdhnā praṇipatyovāca🔽kṣamasva yat tāta mayāparāddhaṃ gajapradānaṃ prati pārthivendra /
analyzed: tatas bodhisatvaḥ pitaram abhigamya mūrdhnā praṇipatya uvāca  kṣamasva yat tāta mayā aparāddham gaja pradānam prati pārthiva indra
translated: Then the Bodhisattva went to his father, bowed his head in homage, and said:🔽Forgive me, father, for what I have done wrong, O lord of kings, in giving away the elephant.

original: eṣa prayāsyāmi purād araṇyaṃ kośakṣayo mā nṛpate tavābhūd // iti
analyzed: eṣa prayāsyāmi purāt araṇyam kośa kṣayaḥ mā nṛpate tava abhūt iti
translated: I will depart from this city to the forest. Let there be no loss of wealth for you, O king.

original: tataḥ putraviyogaviklavo rājā bāṣpoparudhyamānagadgadakaṇṭha uvāca /
analyzed: tatas putra viyoga viklavaḥ rājā bāṣpa uparudhyamāna gadgada kaṇṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Then the king, distraught with the separation from his son, with a voice choked and stammering with tears, said:

original: putra tiṣṭha nivartyatāṃ dānān matir iti / bodhisatva uvāca
analyzed: putra tiṣṭha nivartyatām dānāt matiḥ iti bodhisatvaḥ uvāca
translated: Son, stay! Turn back from giving. The Bodhisattva said:

original: apy eva parivarteta dharā sadharaṇīdharāḥ /
analyzed: api eva parivarteta dharā sa dharaṇīdharāḥ
translated: Even if the earth with its mountains were to turn around,

original: pradānān na tv ahaṃ cittaṃ nivarteyaṃ mahīpate //
analyzed: pradānāt na tu aham cittam nivarteyam mahīpate
translated: O lord of the earth, I would not turn back from giving.

original: ity uktvā prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā prakrāntaḥ
translated: Having said this, he departed.

original: Viśv tataḥ putraduhitṛkalatrasahitaḥ śokotkaṇṭhaiḥ paurajānapadaśatasahasrair anugamyamāno ratham adhiruhya tasmān nagaravarān nirjagāma /
analyzed: tatas putra duhitṛ kalatra sahitaḥ śoka utkaṇṭhaiḥ paura jānapada śata sahasraiḥ anugamyamānaḥ ratham adhiruhya tasmāt nagara varāt nirjagāma
translated: Then, accompanied by his sons, daughters, and wives, followed by hundreds of thousands of citizens and country people, anxious with grief, he mounted a chariot and left that best of cities.

original: Viśv atha kaścit puruṣas taṃ ruditaparidevitaśabdaṃ śrutvā mahājanakāyaṃ ca nagaradvāreṇa nirgacchantaṃ dṛṣṭvānyatamaṃ puruṣam uvāca /
analyzed: atha kaścid puruṣaḥ tam rudita paridevita śabdam śrutvā mahā jana kāyam ca nagara dvāreṇa nirgacchantam dṛṣṭvā anyatamam puruṣam uvāca
translated: Then a certain man, hearing that sound of weeping and lamenting, and seeing that great crowd of people going out through the city gate, said to a certain man:

original: bhoḥ puruṣa kiṃkṛto 'yaṃ mahājanakāyasya rudanaśabda iti / sa uvāca /
analyzed: bhoḥ puruṣa kiṃkṛtaḥ yam mahā jana kāyasya rudana śabdaḥ iti saḥ uvāca
translated: Hey, man, what is the reason for this sound of weeping by this great crowd of people? He said:

original: kiṃ bhavān na jānīte / yad asmad🔽deśāt svakān nṛpatinā svasutaḥ sudaṃṣṭro
analyzed: kim bhavān na jānīte yat asmat  deśāt svakāt nṛpatinā sva sutaḥ sudaṃṣṭro
translated: Don't you know, sir, that our

original: nirvāsyate sthiradhṛtir nirataḥ pradāne /
analyzed: nirvāsyate sthira dhṛtiḥ nirataḥ pradāne
translated: son Sudanṣṭra, who is steadfast and devoted to giving, has been banished from our country by the king?🔽He is going to the forest, and this is the sound of weeping by this great crowd of people.

original: sa prasthito vanam apetya saputradāraḥ
analyzed: sa prasthitaḥ vanam apetya sa putra dāraḥ
translated: He set out for the forest, accompanied by his sons and wife,

original: paurāḥ ca bhṛtya karuṇaṃkaruṇaṃ rudanti //
analyzed: paurāḥ ca bhṛtya karuṇaṃkaruṇam rudanti
translated: and the citizens, weeping piteously, followed him.

original: Viśv tato viśvantaro bodhisatvas tasmān nagaravarān nirgatān paurān yathānyāyam abhigamyovāca /🔽nivartantu nivartantu bhavantaḥ / suciram api hi priyasaṃprayogo bhūtvāvaśyam evānte
analyzed: tatas viśvantaraḥ bodhisatvaḥ tasmāt nagara varāt nirgatān paurān yathānyāyam abhigamya uvāca  nivartantu nivartantu bhavantaḥ su ciram api hi priya saṃprayogaḥ bhūtvā avaśyam eva ante
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Viśvantara, having gone out of that best of cities, properly approached the citizens and said:🔽Turn back, turn back, sirs. For even after a long time, having become united with loved ones, in the end

original: viyogāvasāno bhaviṣyati / vāsavṛkṣādhvapratiśrayabhūto 'pi bandhujanaviyogo 'vaśyabhāvī
analyzed: viyoga avasānaḥ bhaviṣyati vāsa vṛkṣa adhva pratiśraya bhūtaḥ pi bandhu jana viyogaḥ vaśya bhāvī
translated: it will necessarily end in separation. Even a friend who has been like a tree in a house on the road, separation from loved ones is inevitable.

original: priyaviprayogaḥ / kutaḥ
analyzed: priya viprayogaḥ kutas
translated: Where is there

original: sarveṣu lokeṣv avagamya jantoḥ priyair viyogo bhavatīti matvā /
analyzed: sarveṣu lokeṣu avagamya jantoḥ priyaiḥ viyogaḥ bhavati iti matvā
translated: knowing that separation from loved ones occurs to all beings in all worlds,

original: kāryā bhavadbhir bhuvi sarvayatnaiḥ sthirāprakaṃpyā ca śamāya buddhiḥ //
analyzed: kāryā bhavadbhiḥ bhuvi sarva yatnaiḥ sthirā a prakaṃpyā ca śamāya buddhiḥ
translated: you should firmly and unwaveringly set your minds on peace, with all your efforts on earth.🔽Then, seeing the Bodhisattva who had gone beyond thirty yojanas, a certain brahmin approached and said:

original: Viśv atha triṃśadyojanātikrāntaṃ bodhisatvam avekṣyānyatamo brāhmaṇo 'bhigamyovāca /
analyzed: atha triṃśat yojana atikrāntam bodhisatvam avekṣya anyatamaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhigamya uvāca
translated: Your Majesty, I am a brahmin, a poor man,🔽and I have come to you, O King, for the sake of wealth.

original: bhoḥ kṣatriyakumāra itas triṃśanmātrair yojanair adhiṣṭhānaṃ yato 'haṃ bhavato guṇaśravaṇād āgata iti / tad arhasi bhavān anena rathavareṇa
analyzed: bhoḥ kṣatriya kumāraḥ itas triṃśat mātraiḥ yojanaiḥ adhiṣṭhānam yatas ham bhavataḥ guṇa śravaṇāt āgataḥ iti tat arhasi bhavān anena ratha vareṇa
translated: Sir, young Kshatriya, from here, thirty yojanas away, is the place where I come from, having heard of your virtues. Then it is fitting that you should return with this excellent chariot,

original: me saphalaṃ śramaṃ kartum iti /
analyzed: me saphalam śramam kartum iti
translated: Sir, Kshatriya prince, from here, thirty yojanas away, is the place where I have come from, hearing of your virtues. Therefore, you should make my effort fruitful with this excellent chariot.

original: tato mādrī saṃjātāmarṣā niṣṭhurābhidhānena taṃ brāhmaṇam uvāca
analyzed: tatas mādrī saṃjāta amarṣā niṣṭhura abhidhānena tam brāhmaṇam uvāca
translated: Then Madri, feeling indignant, spoke harshly to the Brahmin:

original: aho dvijasyāsya sudāruṇā matir vane 'pi yo 'bhyarthayate nṛpātmajaṃ /
analyzed: aho dvijasya asya su dāruṇā matiḥ vane yaḥ abhyarthayate nṛpa ātmajam
translated: Alas, the mind of this Brahmin is extremely cruel, who even in the forest begs from the prince.

original: na nāma kāruṇyam ihāsya jāyate narendraputre nṛpatiśriyā cyute //
analyzed: na nāma kāruṇyam iha asya jāyate narendra putre nṛpati śriyā cyute
translated: He does not seem to have any compassion for the prince, fallen from the glory of kingship.

original: bodhisatva uvāca /
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ uvāca
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: evaṃ na khalu na khalu bhavatyā brāhmaṇaḥ paribhāṣaṇīyaḥ / kutaḥ
analyzed: evam na khalu na khalu bhavatyā brāhmaṇaḥ paribhāṣaṇīyaḥ kutas
translated: But you should not scold the Brahmin like this. Why?

original: yady ete na bhaveyur arthanadayo mādri pratigrāhakāḥ
analyzed: yadi ete na bhaveyuḥ arthanadayaḥ mādri pratigrāhakāḥ
translated: If there were no beggars like this, O Madri, to receive gifts,

original: bodhiṃ kaḥ samavāpnuyād bhuvi naraḥ sarvapradānād ṛte /
analyzed: bodhim kaḥ samavāpnuyāt bhuvi naraḥ sarva pradānāt ṛte
translated: which man on earth could attain enlightenment without giving everything?

original: ṣaḍbhiḥ pāramitābhir uttamaguṇāḥ saṃbodhisatvāḥ sadā
analyzed: ṣaḍbhiḥ pāramitābhiḥ uttama guṇāḥ saṃbodhisatvāḥ sadā
translated: The Bodhisattvas, who have the highest qualities through the six perfections,

original: dānādyābhir avāpnuvanti niyataṃ sarvajñatām uttamām //
analyzed: dāna ādyābhiḥ avāpnuvanti niyatam sarvajña tām uttamām
translated: always certainly attain the highest omniscience through giving and so forth.

original: Viśv atha bodhisatvas tam apy aśvarathaṃ parameṇa praharṣeṇa tasmai brāhmaṇāya datvovāca
analyzed: atha bodhisatvaḥ tam api aśva ratham parameṇa praharṣeṇa tasmai brāhmaṇāya da tvā uvāca
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, with supreme joy, gave that horse-drawn chariot to the brahmin and said:

original: annena mātsaryamalapravāhiṇā rathapradānena mamāstv iha dvija /
analyzed: annena mātsarya mala pravāhiṇā ratha pradānena mama astu iha dvija
translated: By this gift of a chariot, may I have, here, O brahmin, the chariot of the six great sages,

original: maharṣibhiḥ ṣaḍbhir anupravartito nirāsravo dharmamayo mahārathaḥ //
analyzed: mahā ṛṣibhiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ anupravartitaḥ nirāsravaḥ dharma mayaḥ mahā rathaḥ
translated: which is set in motion by the pure wind of non-attachment, and is made of the pure essence of Dharma.

original: Viśv tato bodhisatvaḥ pramuditahṛdayas tam api rathavaraṃ brāhmaṇāya datvā
analyzed: tatas bodhisatvaḥ pramudita hṛdayaḥ tam api ratha varam brāhmaṇāya da tvā
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, with a joyful heart, gave that excellent chariot to the brahmin,

original: kṛṣṇājināṃ kumārīṃ skandhe āropya mādrī ca jālinaṃ kumāraṃ tapovanābhimukhau saṃprasthitau /
analyzed: kṛṣṇājinām kumārīm skandhe āropya mādrī ca jālinam kumāram tapovana abhimukhau saṃprasthitau
translated: placed the girl Krishnajina on his shoulder, and Madri the boy Jalin, and set out towards the hermitage.🔽In due course they reached the hermitage. Then the Bodhisattva Vishvantara, in that hermitage,

original: anupūrveṇa tapovanam anuprāptau / tato viśvantaro bodhisatvas tasmiṃ tapovane svahṛdayapraritoṣakaraṃ
analyzed: anupūrveṇa tapovanam anuprāptau tatas viśvantaraḥ bodhisatvaḥ tasmin tapovane sva hṛdaya praritoṣa karam
translated: took up a vow that delighted his heart,

original: vratam āsthāya vijahāra /
analyzed: vratam āsthāya vijahāra
translated: and lived there.

original: Viśv tena khalu samayena anyatamasmiṃ karvaṭake brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena anyatamasmin karvaṭake brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati sma
translated: At that time, in a certain hill-fort, a brahmin was living.

original: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītaṃ / sa tayā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramati paricārayati /
analyzed: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītam sa tayā sārdham krīḍati ramati paricārayati
translated: He brought a wife from a suitable family. He played, enjoyed, and amused himself with her.

original: tasya krīḍato ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putro jāta aṣṭādaśabhir apalakṣaṇaiḥ samanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: tasya krīḍataḥ ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putraḥ jāta aṣṭādaśabhiḥ apalakṣaṇaiḥ samanvāgataḥ
translated: While he was playing, amusing, and enjoying himself, a son was born to him, endowed with eighteen inauspicious marks.

original: sa yadā jujjavayati /
analyzed: sa yadā jujjavayati
translated: When he was weaned,

original: tasya jujjuko jujjuka iti saṃjñā saṃvṛttā /🔽Viśv anyatamasmiṃ api karvaṭake brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati caturvedajñas / tena sadṛśāt
analyzed: tasya jujjukaḥ jujjukaḥ iti saṃjñā saṃvṛttā  anyatamasmin api karvaṭake brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati catur veda jñaḥ tena sadṛśāt
translated: he became known as Jujjuka.

original: kulāt kalatram ānītaṃ / sa tayā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramati paricārayati / tasya krīḍato
analyzed: kulāt kalatram ānītam sa tayā sārdham krīḍati ramati paricārayati tasya krīḍataḥ
translated: In a certain mountain village, there lived a brahmin who knew the four Vedas. He took a wife from a family equal to his own. He played, amused, and enjoyed himself with her. While he was playing,

original: ramamāṇasya paricārayato duhitā jātā abhirūpā darśanīyā prāsādikā caturdināvadhinā
analyzed: ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ duhitā jātā abhirūpā darśanīyā prāsādikā catur dina avadhinā
translated: amusing, and enjoying himself, a daughter was born to him, who was beautiful, lovely, and pleasant to behold. In four days

original: mahatī saṃvṛttā / tena brāhmaṇena pratijñā kṛtā /
analyzed: mahatī saṃvṛttā tena brāhmaṇena pratijñā kṛtā
translated: she had grown to the size of a sixteen-year-old. The brahmin made a vow:

original: na mayā kasyacid iyaṃ duhitā rūpeṇa vā kulena vā dhanena vā śilpena vā dātavyāpi tu yo mamāntikāc caturo vedān adhigamiṣyati /
analyzed: na mayā kasyacid iyam duhitā rūpeṇa vā kulena vā dhanena vā śilpena vā dātavyā api tu yaḥ mama antikāt caturaḥ vedān adhigamiṣyati
translated: I will not give this daughter of mine to anyone on account of his beauty, family, wealth, or skill, but rather to whoever will learn the four Vedas from me.

original: tasya mayeyaṃ dātavyā /
analyzed: tasya mayā iyam dātavyā
translated: I will give her to him.

original: Viśv atha jujjuko mantrārthī mantragaveṣī tasya gṛham upasaṃkrāntaḥ / sa tena brāhmaṇenābhihito /
analyzed: atha jujjukaḥ mantra arthī mantra gaveṣī tasya gṛham upasaṃkrāntaḥ sa tena brāhmaṇena abhihitaḥ
translated: Then Jujjuka, seeking mantras and searching for mantras, went to his house. He was told by that brahmin:

original: bho māṇava kutas tvaṃ kiṃ vā prārthayasi
analyzed: bho māṇava kutas tvam kim vā prārthayasi
translated: Sir, young brahmin, where are you from and what do you seek?

original: sa kathayatīcchāmy aham upādhyāyasya pādaśuśruṣāṃ kartuṃ /
analyzed: sa kathayati icchāmi aham upādhyāyasya pāda śuśruṣām kartum
translated: He said, I wish to serve at the feet of the teacher.

original: sa kathayati /
analyzed: sa kathayati
translated: He said,

original: śobhanam evaṃ kuruṣva māṇava / karaṇīyam etad brāhmaṇānāṃ /
analyzed: śobhanam evam kuruṣva māṇava karaṇīyam etat brāhmaṇānām
translated: Excellent, young brahmin, do so. This is the duty of brahmins.

original: Viśv sa tasyāntike vedādhyayanaṃ kartum ārabdhaḥ / sa medhāvī jātīyaḥ / tena alpīyasā kālena catvāro vedā adhītāḥ
analyzed: sa tasya antike veda adhyayanam kartum ārabdhaḥ sa medhāvī jātīyaḥ tena alpīyasā kālena catvāraḥ vedāḥ adhītāḥ
translated: He began to study the Vedas with him. He was intelligent and learned. In a short time he had learned the four Vedas.

original: Viśv sa brāhmaṇaḥ saṃlakṣayati /
analyzed: viśv sa brāhmaṇaḥ saṃlakṣayati
translated: That brahmin thought,

original: mayā pratijñā kṛtā na mayā kasyacid iyaṃ duhitā rūpeṇa vā kulena vā dhanena vā śilpena
analyzed: mayā pratijñā kṛtā na mayā kasyacid iyam duhitā rūpeṇa vā kulena vā dhanena vā śilpena
translated: I made a vow that I would not give this daughter of mine to anyone because of beauty, family, wealth, or skill,

original: vā dātavyā / api tu yo mamāntikāc caturo vedān adhigamiṣyati tasya mayeyaṃ dātavyā /
analyzed: vā dātavyā api tu yaḥ mama antikāt caturaḥ vedān adhigamiṣyati tasya mayā iyam dātavyā
translated: but that I would give her to the one who learns the four Vedas from me.

original: anena ca māṇavakena mamāntikāc caturo vedān adhigatā / ayaṃ ca aṣṭādaśabhir apalakṣaṇaiḥ
analyzed: anena ca māṇavakena mama antikāt caturaḥ vedān adhigatāḥ ayam ca aṣṭādaśabhiḥ apalakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: And this young brahmin has learned the four Vedas from me, and he is endowed with eighteen unfavorable marks.

original: samanvāgataḥ / yady etāṃ dārikāṃ sa pratigṛhṇīyāc chobhanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: samanvāgataḥ yadi etām dārikām sa pratigṛhṇīyāt śobhanam syāt
translated: If he were to accept this girl, it would be good.

original: Viśv tasya tenoktaṃ /
analyzed: viśv tasya tena uktam
translated: He said to him,🔽Young brahmin, I have a daughter who is endowed with eighteen unfavorable marks.🔽If you accept her, I will give her to you.🔽He said, Sir, I will accept her.

original: māṇava mayā pratijñā kṛtā na mayā kasyacid iyaṃ duhitā rūpeṇa vā kulena vā dhanena vā śilpena vā dātavyā /

analyzed: sa kathayati

analyzed: bhadre kutas mama upasthāyakaḥ

analyzed: sā kathayati ārya putra viśvapuryām viśvāmitraḥ nāma rājā tasya putraḥ viśvantaraḥ nāma sa yat kiṃcid yācyate tat sarvam dadāti tasya sakāśān
translated: She said, My husband, in Vishvapuri there is a king named Vishvamitra. His son is named Vishvantara. Whatever he is asked for, he gives it all. From him

analyzed: mama upasthāyakam mṛgaya
translated: you should seek a servant for me.

analyzed: sa kathayati

original: te kathayanti /

translated: In order to liberate the world that is full of suffering, Viśvantara gives away even the earth, by which it trembles.

analyzed: yat nau guroḥ apakṛtam tvayi bāla bāvāt

original: katham adya nu putrakau mama vrajato 'nyasya vaśena duḥkhitau //
analyzed: katham adya nu putrakau mama vrajataḥ nyasya vaśena duḥkhitau
translated: how will my two sons go today, suffering, under the control of another?

original: nayanāṃbupariplutākṣakau virudantau karuṇaṃ suduḥkhitau /
analyzed: nayana aṃbu paripluta akṣakau virudantau karuṇam su duḥkhitau
translated: Their eyes filled with tears, crying piteously, extremely sorrowful,

original: na ca me 'dya sudṛṣṭakau kṛtau kṛpaṇair jīvati duḥkhitau bata //
analyzed: na ca me su dṛṣṭakau kṛtau kṛpaṇaiḥ jīvati duḥkhitau bata
translated: and not well seen by me today, alas, they live in misery.

original: aṃge mama tau vivṛddhakau mūlapuṣpaphalabhojanātmakau /
analyzed: aṃge mama tau vivṛddhakau mūla puṣpa phala bhojana ātmakau
translated: My two sons, who have grown up on roots, flowers, and fruits, are in my body.

original: kṣāntimārdavaiḥ sadā gurupriyau duḥkhitau hi paramaṃ sutau mama //
analyzed: kṣānti mārdavaiḥ sadā guru priyau duḥkhitau hi paramam sutau mama
translated: Always kind and gentle, dear to their elders, those two sons of mine are in great distress.

original: jñātimātṛparihīnakau ca tau bandhubhiś ca sahasā nirākṛtau /
analyzed: jñāti mātṛ parihīnakau ca tau bandhubhiḥ ca sahasā nirākṛtau
translated: Deprived of their relatives and mother, suddenly rejected by their kinsmen,

original: durjanaṃ janam upetya pāpakaṃ duḥkhitau hi paramaṃ sutau mama //
analyzed: durjanam janam upetya pāpakam duḥkhitau hi paramam sutau mama
translated: having gone to a wicked and sinful person, those two sons of mine are in great distress.

original: kṣuttṛṣāparigṛhātmakau sadā kasya tau vaśam upāgamiṣyataḥ /
analyzed: kṣudh tṛṣā parigṛha ātmakau sadā kasya tau vaśam upāgamiṣyataḥ
translated: Always tormented by hunger and thirst, to whose control will they come?

original: ārttiduḥkhaparipīḍitau ca tau preṣyabhāvam upayāsyato dhruvam //
analyzed: ārtti duḥkha paripīḍitau ca tau preṣya bhāvam upayāsyataḥ dhruvam
translated: Afflicted by suffering and distress, they will certainly fall into servitude.

original: karma nūnam iha pāpakaṃ mayā anyajanmani sudāruṇaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: karma nūnam iha pāpakam mayā anya janmani su dāruṇam kṛtam
translated: Surely I have committed a very terrible evil deed in another birth,

original: prāṇinaḥ priyaśatair viyojitā yena gaur iva viraumy adharmikā //
analyzed: prāṇinaḥ priya śataiḥ viyojitāḥ yena gauḥ iva viraumi adharmikā
translated: by which I am crying out like a cow, unrighteously separated from my beloved hundreds of beings.

original: yena satyavacanena me sadā sarvasatvasamatāṃ nataṃ manas /
analyzed: yena satya vacanena me sadā sarva satva sama tām natam manaḥ
translated: By the truth of the words that my mind has always been inclined towards the equality of all beings,

original: tena satyavacanena me sutau dāsabhāvagamanād vimucyatām //
analyzed: tena satya vacanena me sutau dāsa bhāva gamanāt vimucyatām
translated: by that truth, may my two sons be freed from becoming servants.

original: Viśv tato mādrī tābhyāṃ bāladārakābhyāṃ ye vṛkṣā ropitakāḥ pālitakāś ca tān kisalayasaṃchannāṇ dṛṣṭvā sasaṃbhramā pariṣvajyovāca
analyzed: tatas mādrī tābhyām bāla dārakābhyām ye vṛkṣāḥ ropitakāḥ pālitakāḥ ca tān kisalaya saṃchannān dṛṣṭvā sa saṃbhramā pariṣvajya uvāca
translated: Then Madri, seeing those trees planted and tended by those two young boys covered with tender leaves, embraced them with excitement and said:

original: bāla bāla kalaśāvasiktakāḥ pallavāḥ prapatitāśrubindavaḥ /
analyzed: bāla bāla kalaśa avasiktakāḥ pallavāḥ prapatita aśru bindavaḥ
translated: O boys, the tender leaves are like drops of tears sprinkled by the young calves.

original: cetanā iva rudanti vṛkṣakā bālakāḥ stanavihīnakā iveti //
analyzed: cetanāḥ iva rudanti vṛkṣakāḥ bālakāḥ stana vihīnakāḥ iva iti
translated: The trees seem to be crying as if the young boys are deprived of their breasts.

original: Viśv punaś ca tayor bāladārakayoḥ krīḍanakāny āśramavāsino mṛgaśāvakān dṛṣṭvā karuṇādīnavilaṃbitair akṣaraiḥ vacanam uvāca
analyzed: punar ca tayoḥ bāla dārakayoḥ krīḍanakāni āśrama vāsinaḥ mṛga śāvakān dṛṣṭvā karuṇā dīna vilaṃbitaiḥ akṣaraiḥ vacanam uvāca
translated: And again, seeing the young deer that were playmates of those two young boys in the hermitage, she spoke with words that were slow due to compassion and dejection:

original: duḥkham etad aparam hy analpakam yad ramanti mṛgaśāvakā ime /
analyzed: duḥkham etat aparam hi analpakam yat ramanti mṛga śāvakāḥ ime
translated: This is another great sorrow that these young deer are playing here.

original: tad vayasyaparidarśanotsukāḥ sthānakeṣu parimārgamāṇakā //
analyzed: tat vayasya paridarśana utsukāḥ sthānakeṣu
translated: They are eager to see their friends and are searching for them in different places.

original: Viśv tato mādrī yena mārgeṇa tau bāladārakau gatau taṃ mārgam anusarantī tayor bāladārakayor itaś cāmutaś ca padāny ariktakāni dṛṣṭvā
analyzed: tatas mādrī yena mārgeṇa tau bāla dārakau gatau tam mārgam anusarantī tayoḥ bāla dārakayoḥ itas ca amutas ca padāni ariktakāni dṛṣṭvā  /
translated: Then Madri, following the path by which those two young boys had gone, saw the footprints of those two young boys here and there, and

original: tīvraduḥkhābhyāhatā punar uvāca
analyzed: tīvra duḥkha abhyāhatā punar uvāca
translated: overwhelmed by intense sorrow, she spoke again:

original: tāḍyamānau dhruvaṃ nītau yathā padavilaṃbitau /
analyzed: tāḍyamānau dhruvam nītau yathā pada vilaṃbitau
translated: They must have been beaten and taken away, as the footprints are delayed.

original: kvacid gatau gatāvṛttau hā nṛśaṃsa dvijottama //
analyzed: kvacid gatau gata āvṛttau hā nṛśaṃsa dvijottama
translated: Where have you gone, you cruel one, O best of Brahmins?

original: bāṣpagadgadaniruddhakaṇṭhakau vepamānarucirādharauṣṭhakau /
analyzed: bāṣpa gadgada niruddha kaṇṭhakau vepamāna rucira adhara oṣṭhakau
translated: Their throats choked with sobs and stammering, their beautiful lips trembling,

original: tau hi me hariṇapariplutākṣakau komalaiś caraṇakaiḥ kathaṃ gatāv iti //
analyzed: tau hi me hariṇa paripluta akṣakau komalaiḥ caraṇakaiḥ katham gatau iti
translated: Their eyes rolling like those of a deer, and with tender feet, how did they go?

original: Viśv tato bodhisatvas tāṃs tathāparidevanātmikāṃ dṛṣṭvā tābhis tābhiḥ śrutibhir anityatāpratisaṃyuktābhiḥ bahuprakāram anusaṃjñāpayann
analyzed: tatas bodhisatvaḥ tān tathā a paridevanā ātmikām dṛṣṭvā tābhiḥ tābhiḥ śrutibhiḥ anitya tā pratisaṃyuktābhiḥ bahu prakāram anusaṃjñāpayan
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, seeing them lamenting in that way, instructing them in many ways with those various teachings connected with impermanence,

original: na darpān na ca vidveṣān mayā tyaktaṃ sutadvayam /
analyzed: na darpāt na ca vidveṣāt mayā tyaktam suta dvayam
translated: Not out of pride or hatred did I abandon my two children.

original: sarvasatvahitārthaṃ tu tyaktau tau dustyajau sutau //
analyzed: sarva satva hita artham tu tyaktau tau dustyajau sutau
translated: But for the benefit of all beings, I abandoned those two children, so difficult to abandon.

original: ātmaputrakalatrāṃś ca tyaktvā paramadustyajāṃ /
analyzed: ātma putra kalatrān ca tyaktvā parama dustyajām
translated: Having abandoned my own children, wife, and self, which are extremely difficult to abandon,

original: prāpnuvanti mahāsatvā vidhivad bodhim uttamām //
analyzed: prāpnuvanti mahāsatvāḥ vidhivat bodhim uttamām
translated: The great beings attain supreme enlightenment according to the rules.

original: tyāgādhiṣṭhānān mādri putrau yadā te tyaktau dustyājau lokanirmokṣaṇārtham /
analyzed: tyāga adhiṣṭhānāt mādri putrau yadā te tyaktau dustyājau loka nirmokṣaṇa artham
translated: O Mother, when you abandoned your two children, so difficult to abandon, for the sake of liberating the world,

original: dadyāṃ svāṃ dārāṃ vāhanaṃ cāpi vittaṃ sarvaṃ sarvebhyo dātum eṣā matir me // ity
analyzed: dadyām svām vāhanam ca api vittam sarvam sarvebhyaḥ dātum eṣā matiḥ me iti
translated: I would give my own wife and vehicle, and even all my wealth. It is my intention to give everything to everyone.

original: Viśv atha mādrī dhairyam ālaṃbya cittena bodhisatvam uvāca
analyzed: atha mādrī dhairyam ālaṃbya cittena bodhisatvam uvāca
translated: Then Madri, regaining her composure, spoke to the Bodhisattva with her mind:

original: na karomy antarāyaṃ te mā te bhūn matir anyathā /
analyzed: na karomi antarāyam te mā te bhūt matiḥ anyathā
translated: I do not create an obstacle for you. Let your mind not be otherwise.

original: mām apīcchasi ced dātuṃ nirviśaṃkaḥ prayaccha mām //
analyzed: mām api icchasi ced dātum nirviśaṃkaḥ prayaccha mām
translated: If you truly wish to give me away, then give me without hesitation.

original: api ca
analyzed: api ca
translated: Moreover,

original: yasyārthe svajanān vīra tyajasi snehaviklavāṃ /
analyzed: yasya arthe sva janān vīra tyajasi sneha viklavām
translated: O hero, for whose sake you abandon your kinsmen, who are agitated by affection,

original: tam arthaṃ prāpnuhi kṣipraṃ tāraya tribhavāj jagat //🔽Viśv tataḥ śakro devendras tad atyadbhutam atiduṣkaraṃ mādryā bodhisatvasya
analyzed: tam artham prāpnuhi kṣipram tāraya tri bhavāt jagat  tatas śakraḥ deva indraḥ tat ati adbhutam ati duṣkaram mādryāḥ bodhisatvasya
translated: attain that goal quickly, and liberate the world from the three realms of existence.🔽Then Shakra, lord of the gods, having understood that Madri's

original: ca vyavasāyam avagamya tridaśagaṇaparivṛta upari vihāyasā tadāśramam upagamyodāreṇāvabhāsena
analyzed: ca vyavasāyam avagamya tridaśa gaṇa parivṛtaḥ upari vihāyasā tad āśramam upagamya udāreṇa avabhāsena
translated: devotion to the Bodhisattva was extremely wonderful and extremely difficult, surrounded by a group of thirty gods, approached that hermitage through the sky, and illuminating that forest with his majestic radiance,

original: tad vanam avabhāsya gaganatalastha eva bodhisatvam uvāca
analyzed: tat vanam avabhāsya gagana tala sthaḥ eva bodhisatvam uvāca
translated: while remaining in the sky, spoke to the Bodhisattva:

original: yathā mūḍhe loke kumatimatiparyākulamatau
analyzed: yathā mūḍhe loke kumati mati paryākula matau
translated: As the world is deluded, its mind agitated by wrong views and evil thoughts,

original: vibho bhogāsakte sutahṛdayapāśāni sahite /
analyzed: vibho bhoga āsakte suta hṛdaya pāśāni sahite
translated: O Lord, attached to enjoyments, bound by the fetters of the heart of one's son,

original: tvam eko niḥsaṃgas tyajasi tanayāṃ snehajanakāṃ
analyzed: tvam ekaḥ niḥsaṃgaḥ tyajasi tanayām sneha janakām
translated: you alone, unattached, abandon your affectionate daughter,

original: dhruvaṃ kṣemaṃ śāntaṃ vimalam arajaṃ prāpsyasi padam //
analyzed: dhruvam kṣemam śāntam vimalam arajam prāpsyasi padam
translated: you will certainly attain the state of peace, purity, and freedom from defilement and passion.

original: Viśv tad evaṃ protsāhya bodhisatvaṃ śakro devendraś cintayāmāsa /
analyzed: tat evam protsāhya bodhisatvam śakraḥ deva indraḥ cintayāmāsa
translated: Thus, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, having encouraged the Bodhisattva in this way, thought:

original: eko 'yam upasthāyakarahitaḥ khedam āpatsyate / yanv aham apy asmāt prāthayeyam iti / tato bodhisatvasakāśād apakramya brāhmaṇaveṣam āsthāya punar
analyzed: ekaḥ yam upasthāyaka rahitaḥ khedam āpatsyate yanu aham api asmāt prāthayeyam iti tatas bodhisatva sakāśāt apakramya brāhmaṇa veṣam āsthāya punar
translated: This one, being without an attendant, will experience weariness. Let me then request him. Having departed from the presence of the Bodhisattva, assuming the guise of a brahmin,

original: bodhisatvam uvāca🔽imāṃ sarvānavadyāṃgīm anuraktāṃ pativratām /
analyzed: bodhisatvam uvāca  imām sarva anavadya aṃgīm anuraktām pativratām
translated: he again said to the Bodhisattva:🔽Give me this one, who is faultless in all limbs, devoted, and faithful to her husband,

original: saṃprayaccha kulaślāghyāṃ mama bhṛtyārthabhāginīṃ //
analyzed: saṃprayaccha kula ślāghyām mama bhṛtya artha bhāginīm
translated: who is worthy of praise in the family, and who is a sharer in my service.

original: Viśv tato mādrī saṃjātāmarṣā niṣṭhurābhidhānena taṃ brāhmaṇam uvāca
analyzed: tatas mādrī saṃjāta amarṣā niṣṭhura abhidhānena tam brāhmaṇam uvāca
translated: Then Madrī, feeling indignation, spoke to that brahmin with harsh words:

original: nirlajjaś cāsi lubdhaś ca tvam iha brāhmaṇādhama /
analyzed: nirlajjaḥ ca asi lubdhaḥ ca tvam iha brāhmaṇa adhama
translated: You are shameless and greedy, you lowest of brahmins,

original: saddharmaniratāṃ yas tvaṃ mām icchasi pativratām //
analyzed: saddharma niratām yaḥ tvam mām icchasi pativratām
translated: since you desire me, who am devoted to the true Dharma and faithful to my husband.

original: Viśv tato bodhisatvaḥ karuṇāparigatahṛdayo mādrīṃ nirīkṣitum ārabdhaḥ / atha mādrī bodhisatvam uvāca
analyzed: tatas bodhisatvaḥ karuṇā parigata hṛdayaḥ mādrīm nirīkṣitum ārabdhaḥ atha mādrī bodhisatvam uvāca
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, his heart filled with compassion, began to look at Madrī. Then Madrī said to the Bodhisattva:

original: na śocāmy aham ātmānaṃ nāpekṣā me tathātmani /
analyzed: na śocāmi aham ātmānam na apekṣā me tathā ātmani
translated: I do not grieve for myself, nor do I care for myself as much,

original: yathā tvām anuśocāmi katham eko bhaviṣyasi //
analyzed: yathā tvām anuśocāmi katham ekaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: as I grieve for you, thinking how you will be alone.

original: tato bodhisatvo mādrīm uvāca
analyzed: tatas bodhisatvaḥ mādrīm uvāca
translated: Then the Bodhisattva said to Madri:

original: aham iha bhuvi mādri nānuśocyaḥ parimṛgayaṃ padam akṣayaṃ viśokam /
analyzed: aham iha bhuvi mādri na anuśocyaḥ parimṛgayam padam akṣayam viśokam
translated: Here on earth, Madri, I should not be grieved over, seeking this imperishable state, free from sorrow.

original: tam imam anusara dvijaṃ viśokā mṛgaśaraṇaṃ tv aham āśrame 'bhyupaimi //
analyzed: tam imam anusara dvijam viśokā mṛga śaraṇam tu aham āśrame bhyupaimi
translated: Follow this brahmin, free from sorrow, but I will go to the hermitage in the deer sanctuary.

original: Viśv iti viditvā hṛṣṭatuṣṭapramuditamanāś cintayāmāsa
analyzed: viśu iti viditvā hṛṣṭa tuṣṭa pramudita manāḥ cintayāmāsa
translated: Having understood this, with a delighted, satisfied, and joyful mind, he thought:

original: idam asmiṃ vane dānaṃ paścimaṃ me bhaviṣyati
analyzed: idam asmin vane dānam paścimam me bhaviṣyati
translated: This will be my last gift in this forest,

original: mādrīpriyāṃ parityajya bhaviṣyāmy aparigrahaḥ //
analyzed: mādrī priyām parityajya bhaviṣyāmi a parigrahaḥ
translated: renouncing my beloved Madri, I will become one without possessions.

original: iti viditvā mādrīṃ ca pāṇinā gṛhītvā taṃ brāhmaṇam uvāca🔽bhāvānuraktaśuśrūṣāṃ sadvṛttāṃ priyavādinīm /
analyzed: iti viditvā mādrīm ca pāṇinā gṛhītvā tam brāhmaṇam uvāca  bhāva anurakta śuśrūṣām sat vṛttām priya vādinīm
translated: Having understood this, he took Madri by the hand and said to the brahmin:🔽Take this wife of mine, who is devoted, obedient, virtuous, and pleasant-spoken,

original: mama bhāryām imāṃ śiṣyāṃ gṛhāṇa tvaṃ dvijottama //
analyzed: mama bhāryām imām śiṣyām gṛhāṇa tvam dvijottama
translated: as your disciple, O best of brahmins.

original: Viśv tataḥ patnīm upaspṛśya tyajato bodhikāṃkṣayā /
analyzed: tatas patnīm upaspṛśya tyajataḥ bodhi kāṃkṣayā
translated: Then, as he touched his wife and abandoned her out of his desire for enlightenment,

original: ṣaḍvikāramahī kṛtsnā cacālāmbhasi naur yathā //
analyzed: ṣaṣ vikāra mahī kṛtsnā cacāla ambhasi nauḥ yathā
translated: the entire earth trembled in six ways, like a boat on water.

original: Viśv tato mādrī bāṣpoparudhyamānā gadgadakaṇṭhī brāhmaṇavaśam āgatā patiputraduhitṛvirahitā idam abhravīt
analyzed: tatas mādrī bāṣpa uparudhyamānā gadgada kaṇṭhī brāhmaṇa vaśam āgatā pati putra duhitṛ virahitā idam abhravīt
translated: Then Madri, her voice choked with tears, stammering, under the control of the brahmin, separated from her husband, sons, and daughters, said this:

original: kīdṛṅ mayā kṛtaṃ karma anāryaṃ pūrvajanmasu /
analyzed: kīdṛś mayā kṛtam karma anāryam pūrva janmasu
translated: What inauspicious deed have I done in my past lives,

original: naṣṭavatseva gaur yena viraumi vijane vane //
analyzed: naṣṭa vatsā iva gauḥ yena viraumi vijane vane
translated: that I am crying alone in this desolate forest, like a cow that has lost her calf?

original: Viśv tataḥ śakro devendro brāhmaṇaveṣam antardhāpya svaveṣeṇa sthitvā mādrīm uvāca
analyzed: tatas śakraḥ deva indraḥ brāhmaṇa veṣam antardhāpya sva veṣeṇa sthitvā mādrīm uvāca
translated: Then Shakra, the lord of the gods, disappeared in the form of a brahmin and appeared in his own form, and said to Madri:

original: na brāhmaṇo 'smi subhage na ca mānuṣo 'smi
analyzed: na brāhmaṇaḥ smi subhage na ca mānuṣaḥ smi
translated: I am not a brahmin, O beautiful one, nor am I human.

original: śakras tv ahaṃ hy asuranāśakaraḥ surendraḥ /
analyzed: śakraḥ tu aham hi asura nāśa karaḥ sura indraḥ
translated: I am Shakra, the lord of the gods, the destroyer of demons.

original: prīto 'smy anena vinayena tavottamena
analyzed: prītaḥ smi anena vinayena tava uttamena
translated: I am pleased with this excellent humility of yours.

original: tad brūhi kiṃ varam apīcchasi matsakāśāt //
analyzed: tat brūhi kim varam api icchasi mad sakāśāt
translated: So tell me, what boon do you desire from me?

original: tato mādrī tadvacanajanitasaumanasyā śakraṃ praṇipatyovāca
analyzed: tatas mādrī tad vacana janita saumanasyā śakram praṇipatya uvāca
translated: Then Madri, her joy arising from his words, bowed to Shakra and said:

original: mama putrau sahasrākṣa dāsabhāvād vimocaya /
analyzed: mama putrau sahasrākṣa dāsa bhāvāt vimocaya
translated: O thousandeyed one, free my two sons from slavery.

original: pitāmahasakāśaṃ ca prāpaya tridaśeśvara //
analyzed: pitāmaha sakāśam ca prāpaya tridaśeśvara
translated: And take them to their grandfather, O lord of the thirty gods.

original: Viśv tathety uktvā mahendraḥ punar āśramaṃ praviśya bodhisatvasakāśam abhijagmivān / mādrīṃ ca vāmena pāṇinā gṛhītvā bodhisatvam uvāca
analyzed: tathā iti uktvā mahā indraḥ punar āśramam praviśya bodhisatva sakāśam abhijagmivān mādrīm ca vāmena pāṇinā gṛhītvā bodhisatvam uvāca
translated: Vishva Mitra said: Having said So be it, the great Indra again entered the hermitage and went to the Bodhisattva, and taking Madri by his left hand, said to the Bodhisattva:

original: ahaṃ mādrīm imāṃ tubhyaṃ dadāmi paricārikām /
analyzed: aham mādrīm imām tubhyam dadāmi paricārikām
translated: I give this Madri to you as a servant.

original: na ca te kasyacid deyā nyāsadroho hi garhitaḥ //
analyzed: na ca te kasyacid deyāḥ nyāsa drohaḥ hi garhitaḥ
translated: And they should not be given to anyone, for betraying a trust is condemned.

original: Viśv tataḥ śakro devendras taṃ bāladārakaparigṛhītāraṃ brāhmaṇaṃ tathā vyāmohayāmāsa
analyzed: tatas śakraḥ deva indraḥ tam bāla dāraka parigṛhītāram brāhmaṇam tathā vyāmohayāmāsa
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, so deluded that brāhmaṇa who had taken the two children in his arms

original: yathānyanagaraśaṃkayā tad eva nagaram upagamya tau bāladārakau vikrītum ārabdho yāvad
analyzed: yathā anya nagara śaṃkayā tat eva nagaram upagamya tau bāla dārakau vikrītum ārabdhaḥ yāvat
translated: that out of fear of another city, he went to that very city and started to sell the two children.

original: amātyair dṛṣṭvā rājño niveditaṃ
analyzed: amātyaiḥ dṛṣṭvā rājñaḥ niveditam
translated: When the ministers saw this, they reported it to the king:

original: etau putrasya te putrau brāhmaṇo 'smin purottame /
analyzed: etau putrasya te putrau brāhmaṇaḥ u smin pura uttame
translated: These two are the grandsons of your son. A brāhmaṇa

original: jālinaṃ ceva kṛṣṇāṃ ca vikrīṇīte ti dāruṇaḥ //
analyzed: jālinam ca iva kṛṣṇām ca vikrīṇīte dāruṇaḥ
translated: is cruelly selling Jālin and Kṛṣṇa in this best of cities.

original: Viśv etac chrutvodbhrāntacittaḥ sa rājā prāha kṣipraṃ darśayadhvaṃ kumārau /
analyzed: etat śrutvā udbhrānta cittaḥ sa rājā prāha kṣipram darśayadhvam kumārau
translated: Hearing this, the king, his mind agitated, said, Quickly show me the princes.

original: nāryaś cakruḥ krośam antaḥpurasthāḥ paurā rājñaḥ kṣipram eyuḥ samīpam //🔽yāvad anyatamenāmātyena rājñaḥ sakāśam upanītau
analyzed: nāryaḥ cakruḥ krośam antaḥpura sthāḥ paurāḥ rājñaḥ kṣipram eyuḥ samīpam  yāvat anyatamena amātyena rājñaḥ sakāśam upanītau
translated: The women in the inner quarters cried out. The citizens quickly came near the king.🔽Then one minister brought the two princes before the king.

original: putrau nirīkṣya sa nṛpo 'bhimukhopanītau
analyzed: putrau nirīkṣya sa nṛpaḥ abhimukha upanītau
translated: Seeing the two princes brought before him,

original: kṣīṇasvarau kṛśatanū maladigdhagātrau /
analyzed: kṣīṇa svarau kṛśa tanū mala digdha gātrau
translated: with weak voices, emaciated bodies, and dirt-covered limbs,

original: siṃhāsanāt kṣititale sahasā papātaḥ
analyzed: siṃhāsanāt kṣiti tale sahasā papātaḥ
translated: the king suddenly fell from his lion throne to the ground.

original: paurā vicukruśur amātyagaṇāḥ striyaś ca //
analyzed: paurāḥ vicukruśuḥ amātya gaṇāḥ striyaḥ ca
translated: The citizens, the groups of ministers, and the women cried out.

original: Viśv tato rājā amātyān āmantrayate
analyzed: viśu tatas rājā amātyān āmantrayate
translated: Then the king said to his ministers:

original: vane 'pi vasato dāneṣv abhirataṃ manaḥ /
analyzed: vane pi vasataḥ dāneṣu abhiratam manaḥ
translated: Even while living in the forest, my mind is devoted to giving.

original: tam ihānayata kṣipraṃ patnyā sārdhaṃ sulocanam //
analyzed: tam iha ānayata kṣipram patnyā sārdham su locanam
translated: So quickly bring him here, the one with beautiful eyes, together with his wife.

original: Viśv tataḥ śakro devendro bodhisatvam abhinamasyamānaḥ svabhavanam upajagāma /
analyzed: tatas śakraḥ deva indraḥ bodhisatvam abhinamasyamānaḥ sva bhavanam upajagāma
translated: Then Shakra, lord of the gods, bowed to the Bodhisattva and went to his own abode.

original: Viśv śakreṇa ca rājani viśvāmitre abhyatīte brāhmaṇāmātyapaurajānapadaiḥ sārdhaṃ tad āśramapadaṃ gatvā bodhisatvaṃ yācitvā svapuram ānīya
analyzed: viśu  śakreṇa ca rājani viśvāmitre abhyatīte brāhmaṇa amātya paura jānapadaiḥ sārdham tat āśrama padam gatvā bodhisatvam yācitvā sva puram ānīya
translated: And when King Vishvamitra had passed away, Shakra, together with the Brahmins, ministers, citizens, and country people, went to that hermitage, requested the Bodhisattva, brought him to his own city,

original: rājye pratiṣṭhāpitavān /
analyzed: rājye pratiṣṭhāpitavān
translated: and established him in the kingdom.

original: Viśv tato viśvantaro rājā sarvaṃdado babhūva / sa śraṃanabrāhmaṇavanīpakasuhṛtsambandhibāndhavānujīvijaneṣu anekaprakārāṇi dānāni datvā
analyzed: tatas viśvantaraḥ rājā sarvaṃdadaḥ babhūva sa śraṃana brāhmaṇa vanīpaka suhṛd sambandhi bāndhava anujīvi janeṣu aneka prakārāṇi dānāni da tvā
translated: Then King Vishvantara became one who gives everything. He gave various kinds of gifts to ascetics, Brahmins, merchants, friends, relatives, and dependents,

original: puṇyāni kṛtvā gāthāṃ bhāṣate
analyzed: puṇyāni kṛtvā gāthām bhāṣate
translated: and having made merits, he spoke this verse:

original: bodhiṃ prārthayamānena dānaṃ deyaṃ viśāradaḥ /
analyzed: bodhim prārthayamānena dānam deyam viśāradaḥ
translated: Generous giving should be given by one who aspires for enlightenment, without fear,

original: kṣatriye brāhmaṇe vaiśye śūdre caṇḍālapukkase //
analyzed: kṣatriye brāhmaṇe vaiśye śūdre caṇḍālapukkase
translated: to a Kshatriya, Brahmin, Vaishya, Shudra, Chandala, or Pukkasha.

original: hiraṇyaṃ ca suvarṇaṃ ca gavāśvamaṇikuṇḍalam //
analyzed: hiraṇyam ca suvarṇam ca gavāśva maṇi kuṇḍalam
translated: Gold, silver, cows, horses, jewels, earrings,

original: dadyāt saṃpannaśīlebhyo dāsakarmakaraṃ tathā //
analyzed: dadyāt saṃpanna śīlebhyaḥ dāsa karmakaram tathā
translated: and also servants and laborers should be given to those of accomplished character.

original: sutadāraparityāgaṃ kṛtvā muktena cetasā /
analyzed: suta dāra parityāgam kṛtvā muktena cetasā
translated: Having abandoned one's children and wife with a liberated mind,

original: prāpnuvanti narāḥ śuddhim asmiṃ loke paratra ceti //🔽Viśv yadā viśvāmitreṇa rājñā viśvantaranimittaṃ jujjukāya brāhmaṇāya prabhūtaṃ
analyzed: prāpnuvanti narāḥ śuddhim asmin loke paratra ca iti  viśu yadā viśvāmitreṇa rājñā viśvantara nimittam jujjukāya brāhmaṇāya prabhūtam
translated: men attain purity in this world and the next.

original: dhanaṃ dattaṃ tadāsau vistīrṇavibhavo jātaḥ / tasya suhṛtsambandhibāndhavā mitrāṇi cāgamya kathayanti /
analyzed: dhanam dattam tadā asau vistīrṇa vibhavaḥ jātaḥ tasya suhṛd sambandhi bāndhavāḥ mitrāṇi ca āgamya kathayanti
translated: When Viśvāmitra, the king, gave much wealth to the brāhmaṇa Jujjuka for the sake of Viśvantara, then he became one of extensive wealth. His friends, relatives, kinsmen, and friends came and said:

original: yā kācit tava śrīsaubhāgyasaṃpat sarvāsau viśvantarakumāram āgamyeti / sa kathayati /
analyzed: yā kācid tava śrī saubhāgya saṃpad sarvā asau viśvantara kumāram āgamyā iti sa kathayati
translated: Whatever prosperity and good fortune you have, all that is due to Prince Viśvantara. He said:

original: kiṃ mama viśvantareṇa kṛtam uttamavarṇaprasūto 'haṃ /
analyzed: kim mama viśvantareṇa kṛtam uttama varṇa prasūtaḥ haṃ
translated: What has Viśvantara done for me? I am born of a noble family.

original: dakṣiṇīyo lokasya /
analyzed: dakṣiṇīyaḥ lokasya
translated: I am worthy of offerings in the world.

original: yena mama bhogā upanayanti /
analyzed: yena mama bhogāḥ upanayanti
translated: By whom my enjoyments are brought.

original: Viśv bhagavān āha /
analyzed: viśv bhagavān āha
translated: Viśvāmitra said:

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau viśvantaro nāma rājakumāra aham eva sa tena kālena
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau viśvantaraḥ nāma rāja kumāra aham eva sa tena kālena
translated: What do you think, monks? I myself at that time was the prince named Viśvantara.

original: tena samayena / yo 'sau jujjuko brāhmaṇa eṣa evāsau devadattas tena kālena tena samayena /
analyzed: tena samayena yaḥ sau jujjukaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ eṣaḥ eva asau devadattaḥ tena kālena tena samayena
translated: At that time, the brahmin Jujjuka was none other than Devadatta at that time, at that juncture.

original: tadāpy eṣa akṛtajñaḥ akṛtavedī / etarhy apy eṣa akṛtajña akṛtavedī / tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ
analyzed: tadā api eṣa akṛtajñaḥ akṛtavedī etarhi api eṣa akṛtajña akṛtavedī tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ
translated: Then too he was ungrateful and unthankful, and now too he is ungrateful and unthankful. Therefore, monks,

original: evaṃ śikṣitavyaṃ yat kṛtajñā bhaviṣyāmaḥ kṛtavedinaḥ svalpam api kṛtaṃ na nāśayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: evam śikṣitavyam yat kṛtajñāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ kṛta vedinaḥ su alpam api kṛtam na nāśayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: you should train thinking, ‘We will be grateful and thankful. We will not destroy even a small favor,🔽let alone a large one.’

original: prāg eva prabhūtaṃ / ity evaṃ vo bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: prāk eva prabhūtam iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.”

original: viśvantarāvadānaṃ samāptam /
analyzed: viśvantara avadānam samāptam
translated: The story of Viśvantara is finished.
